name: Mega Soccer Online Trivia | Soccer | 10 Questions

questions.text: What can you not use when playing soccer?
questions.explanation:
Hands.

	If you use your hands it is handball, and a free kick to the other side. This excludes the two goal-keepers, and a throw-in!

questions.text: How many players from each team are there allowed to be on the field at the same time?
questions.explanation:
11.

	Ten outfield players plus the goalie.

questions.text: What happens if you get a red card?
questions.correct: You are ejected out of the game
options: The other team gets a goal
questions.explanation:
You are ejected out of the game.

	A yellow card means 'you're booked', you get a warning.

questions.text: How many forwards do most teams have have?
questions.explanation:
2.

	In some countries forwards also are called Strikers.

questions.text: What happens if a defender commits a handball offence in his team's 18 yard box?
questions.explanation:
A penalty shot is awarded.

	If it's outside the box it's a free kick.

questions.text: Which team was the first to win the World Cup three times?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	Brazil were the first to win it three times; Italy was the second:1958, 1962, 1970 - Brazil1934, 1838, 1982 - Italy1954, 1974, 1990 - Germany.

questions.text: When did Canada first qualify to play in the World Cup finals tournament?
questions.explanation:
1986 Mexico.

	Canada failed ot score a goal and lost all three of its group matches (France 1-0, Hungary 2-0 and USSR 3-0).

questions.text: Which team did Pele play for?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	Pele was one of the best soccer players ever.

questions.text: What was the highest scoring draw in the top tier of English football?
questions.explanation:
6-6.

	6-6 Leicester City v Arsenal (Division One) played on 21st April 1930. The half-time score was 3-1.
